 First off, hello.
 
 I think the real problem with utopianistic attempts is that they somehow think that humans are perfectable, provided that some social problem (insert one here) is resolved. Once the "social ill" is removed, utopian thinking goes, everyone with change/revert back to/evolve into some perfect 'superman' and conflicting ideas will cease.
 
 All of these utopian ideas; communism, anarchy, socialism, etc., fail to recognize man's foilables. Interestingly enough, religion recognizes man's imperfection, and also promises to correct them, just not on this level of existance. But is does promise some change in behavior for its adherants (and this is true both for monotheistic and politheistic religions) .
 
 But the worst crimes in history prior to the 20th Century were committed when attempts to merge the two were made - the Inquisitions, Wahabiist Islamic slaughters, and the various Caste wars in India occured when the promises of a perfect existance later were tried to be forced to exist upon Earth. And they failed at the cost of untold millions of lives. 
 
 The 20th Century brings us Godless utopianist efforts, and the murder rate for their attempts to force man to perfect himself were the worst yet. 
 
 I think the real problem is man's own refusal to recognize he isn't perfectable here on Earth, irregardless of religious beliefs.
 
 Peace, Tom

 It is WHERE man attempts to perfect himself that is the problem.

Do you mean the scientists are normal human beings and the world is as we know it apart from this experiment? If you mean that then isn't it more of a question to do with how the brain works instead of philosophy?
 
 Or do you mean that can we be certain that our reality is real and not just something created to fool us? If you mean that then there is no way of knowing that we aren't part of some science experiment and all we have is a brain so we may aswell take our reality for what it is because theres nothing to tell us otherwise.

The reason the above experiment is impossible is state below.
 Then again this is my opinion, as always
 
 If the brain were to be hooked up to a vat and impulses sent into the brain to make it think it were on the beach for example...
 The goal of the expirement is to make the brain think it is living in a 3d human world with free will. So for instance you could send the impulses to the brain that, it is laying on the beach. But the scientists encounter the following problem...
 
 What if the brain wanted to move its finger in the sand. Then at the spur of the moment the scientists must have those impulses to send. They must be prepared for infinite options the brain has in this 3d world. 
 
 Cause and affect
 
 The scientists must have the effect prepared before hand which is impossible if the brain has true "free will". 
 
 Once again a breif summary of why I think the whole "brain in the vat" idea is impossible. 
 Therfor I don't think that ideas like the Matrix, or virtual reality are possible. 
 I only mean virtual reality in this context, with this much interaction.
as thrilling as all these ideas are, perhaps they need seperate topics so we can keep track?

if they were going to build a beach scenario for the brain, they'd make the necessary effects for things one could do at the beach. If the brain starting trying to give input for things not considered, you could just turn it off and reset. Sure, it would be confusing as krunk for the brain person, but whatever.
if the brain would somehow be reset to remember nothing, we could create any world with its own physics. ooo, fun to play god.

The brain in the vat would have no comparison to the outside world. How would the brain in the vat know what his  mirrior's  finger in the sand felt like? It could feel like anything, so the scientist could just use something, anything. 
 
 He would be fooling the brain, even if the brain had felt that exact texture before, his other senses would fool him, and the fact that it looked like his finger was touching the sand, would derive its own feel. It looked like it was smooth and the grains were small, so the texture that the scientist imported would be altered by the virtual mirrior of the brain's perspective.

Speed or any quanta for that matter can only be defined by giving reference to a point in timespace. For the sake of science this point is known as the observer. Well newtonian physics was fine it worked well in defineing everything relitive to the earth sun or other objects common to us all. We were not forced to think of ourselves as unique observers. Dear old Einstine made it much more personal. The 300 000m/s of light has to be relitive to something or else you can not say that is the speed.
 
 So in the modern era we return to Lao Tzu and the concept of duality. Relationships. It is truly wierd do not shoot the messanger. Light always stays the same speed. It does not matter who is the observer. Even the speed of the source is not relevent.
 
 We know that E=MC2 means light energy= Matter. The C2 bit denotes the relationship. That is matter is energy locked up in the temporal state of thermol dynamics. So it is a very weird world indeed. Energy contained by Fields of energy locked up in the laws of the time space continume.
 
 My point is thier is no ultamate truth. We are unique observers and everything is relitive to our own properties with in the continume. No matter what ship your in moon your on planet your on light will always travel for you at 300 000m/s. To people moving away from each other at a fraction of that speed will see the speed of light travel at 300 000m/s. Light refuses to speed up or slow down no matter how fast you run at it. It only makes sence if we live in our own uneique universe. Billions of observers means billions of differnt realites.
 
 The special thing is how we meat up in this place. The way we interact. The common source of DNA. The way we work together to build citys and nations. This thing we call culture seems to escape scientific observation. The spirit of the nation superseeds any one man. This lust for God and meaning. Mortality and how we can ignore it in our persute of love. The emotions of man have the ability to prepell us into the etherial.
 
 What is it to be man? What is it to be? Is our internal world a reflection of the external or is the external world a reflection of the internal? The gene pool and bioligy suggests we are temporal manifestaions of the same thing. Points of the same energy seperated by the illusion of space time. What is Love? does this thing that binds lovers bind the universe. The love of a mother for a child has no qanta regardless the oberver.
